department.ch: 國際經營管理碩士學位學程
department.en: International Master of Business Administration program

goal.ch: Students are expected to develop a solid foundation in microeconomic analysis, master the basic modelling tools to construct economic models in explaining individual, consumer, and firm’s behavior, derive insights on and evaluate the welfare effects of economic policies.
goal.en: Students are expected to develop a solid foundation in microeconomic analysis, master the basic modelling tools to construct economic models in explaining individual, consumer, and firm’s behavior, derive insights on and evaluate the welfare effects of economic policies.

outline.ch: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of microeconomic analysis and enable students’ application of economic tools in understanding and analyzing different economic problems to have a systematic view on the working of economics in the contemporary world.
outline.en: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of microeconomic analysis and enable students’ application of economic tools in understanding and analyzing different economic problems to have a systematic view on the working of economics in the contemporary world.

textbook.ch:
Our lectures closely follow Munoz-Garcia, Felix (2017), Advanced Microeconomic Theory: An Intuitive Approach with Examples, 1st Edition, Cambridge, MA: MIT Press (hereinto ““FMG““). Please obtain a copyright version of the textbook to help you better understand the lecture materials and work on the problem sets. I also recommend the accompanying workbook that provides step-to-step workout of odd-number questions, both can be obtained from the campus bookstore or online at www.amazon.com. Supplementary learning materials, such as journal articles and workout examples, will be distributed from time to time. You may also consult the following textbooks for further references.

From a more theoretical side, you may read Mas-Colell, Andreu, Whinston, Michael D., and Green, Jerry R. (1995), Microeconomic Theory, 1st Edition, Cambridge, UK: Oxford University Press (hereinto ““MWG““) if you are interested in technical proofs and model-building. A book that focuses on both theory and application which I recommend is Varian Hal R. (1992), Microeconomic Analysis, 3rd Edition, Hoboken, NJ: John Wiley ＆ Sons, Inc. From a more applied side, you may study Jehle, Geoffrey A. and Reny, Philip J. (2011), Advanced Microeconomic Theory, 3rd Edition, Upper Saddle River, NJ: Prentice Hall (hereinto ““JR““) to help you form an intuition on the mechanics of economic models.
